sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's Tuesday the 30th of November. Good morning Europe, a very warm welcome to the program.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Concerns mount over the COVID-19 Omicron variant as more countries report cases of the highly mutated virus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: France honors American-born entertainer, resistance spy and civil rights activist Josephine Baker with a place in the Paris pantheon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And a seventh win for Lionel Messi, who's taken football's Ballon d'Or trophy once again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: An increasing number of countries around the world are reporting their first cases of the new highly mutated Covid-19 variant Omicron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: And governments are slamming shut their doors on international travel, while scientists race to figure out just how dangerous the mutant version might be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We don't yet know whether Omicron is associated with more transmission, more severe disease, more risk of reinfections or more risk of evading vaccines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Scientists at WHO and around the world are working urgently to answer these questions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Omicron's very emergence is another reminder that although many of us might think we're done with COVID-19, it's not done with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Spain has become one of the latest countries to report its first confirmed Omicron case. It was found

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: in a traveller who returned Sunday from South Africa, the country where the new variant was first detected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: While the vast majority of infections recorded around the world have been travellers arriving from abroad, cases in Portugal and Scotland have raised fears that Omicron may already be spreading locally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the travel restrictions being re-imposed are ranging from banning all incoming flights to barring entry to foreign visitors to Israel and Japan, for instance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The UK, along with others, is calling for all visitors to have a PCR test on arrival and to isolate until the individual have a PCR test on arrival and to isolate until the individual gets a negative test result.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Most European Union members are also expanding their vaccination programmes. It's not to be forgotten that Delta is still the dominant variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: And despite the global worry, scientists claim they are confident that if given time they will be able to adapt or develop vaccines to counter the new variant if needed. The key factor is time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ladies and gentlemen, Her Excellency Dame Sandra Prunella Mason, President of Barbados.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Barbados, the newest republic in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Caribbean island has waved goodbye to Queen Elizabeth II as head of state as it cuts ties with its colonial past and becomes a republic for the first time in history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Parliament of the former British colony, once nicknamed Little England, elected its first ever president in a two-thirds majority vote last month following a push to become a republic that began in the 1990s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On Monday evening, new president Sandra Mason was sworn in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Barbados will remain a member of the Commonwealth realm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said in a statement that the two countries would remain friends and allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: France's interior minister has outlined the need for an accord with Britain over illegal migration across the English Channel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Gérald Damelan's comments followed a meeting with European officials which the UK was uninvited from.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The EU's border agency has agreed to deploy a plane to monitor the English Channel. with European officials which the UK was uninvited from.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The EU's border agency has agreed to deploy a plane to monitor the English Channel and has pledged to work closely with European nations to tackle migrant smuggling networks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Despite recent tensions between the UK and France, Darmanin said the door is still open for Britain to rejoin talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: in France, Darmanin said the door is still open for Britain to rejoin talks. It's in the common interest of Europe and Great Britain to work together to try and resolve this problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: And to work together to cooperate, there needs to be two sides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: From the moment when the double talking from Great Britain stops, and there is a serious attitude, when we can talk in our exchanges in private, correspond to those taking place in public, then the French government is absolutely ready to resume discussions with Great Britain very quickly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Euronews international correspondent Annelies Borges says there is a lot of ground to be made up in French and British relations following a series of diplomatic missteps from the UK. Gérald Demanin was quite blunt and even harsh when it comes to his British counterpart and British officials who he says, who he's accused of a double discourse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said that in private the conversations and the negotiations go one way, but then in public they change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Of course, France is still very upset about the leaking of that letter. He says there is no trust that can remain in place in that way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And he says that it's very important for Britain to start walking the walk and no longer only promising, but working towards actually cooperating with France. He says it's in both sides' interest to fix this problem, to tackle migration, illegal migration in that way, one that, of course, is responsible for tragedies like the one we saw last week when 27 people died in the English Channel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Gerard Amanin also said that it's very important for Britain to actually cooperate with France, but that can only happen through the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He said that it's time for a European agreement between Europe and Britain and the U.K.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He says that he reminded the press today that the U.K. decided to leave the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That was a very unfortunate decision, but that was their decision, and that now all negotiations must go through, Europe must go through at a European level. We don't know for now whether or not what Jean Castex is going to be promising, proposing to Boris Johnson tomorrow is going to be anything that could evolve into an agreement between the European Union and Britain. But certainly today a show of force of sorts from France and a very resolute interior minister saying that Britain is the cause of all this, saying that even though the two sides don't agree on what is happening, we can't change geography, according to Gerard de Manel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: She's accused of having procured and groomed girls as young as 14 for the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The trial of British socialite Ghislaine Maxwell finally gets underway in New York on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The sex crimes are alleged to have taken place at several of Epstein's properties, including his Manhattan townhouse and his Palm Beach mansion in Florida.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Prosecutors claim Maxwell, a former girlfriend of Epstein, gained the girls' trust in order to lure them into illegal sex acts with him. Four accusers are set to take the stand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The 59-year-old daughter of former press baron Robert Maxwell has pleaded not guilty to sex trafficking and other crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: She faces up to 80 years in prison if convicted on all counts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Epstein, a financier, philanthropist but also a prolific paedophile, killed himself while awaiting trial for sex crimes in 2019 the trial

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: of Ghislaine Maxwell got underway Monday afternoon here in New York City where prosecutors called their first witness Jeffrey Epstein's longtime pilot where he described in broad strokes the role Ghislaine Maxwell played in managing Epstein's properties and household describing their relationship as being quote couple-ish. In their opening statement prosecutors said that Maxwell was Epstein's partner in crime and not just the facilitator. The defense argued that Maxwell was being made a scapegoat. The 59-year-old faces six criminal charges and could face up to 70 years in prison if convicted. She maintains that she's innocent. She is accused of helping quote recruit, groom and ultimately abuse four teenage girls for sexual acts with Jeffrey Epstein.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Those four accusers will take the stand in the days and weeks to come in a trial which is expected to take up to six weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Susan Tejwani reporting for Euronews from New York. Where else would Jack Dorsey make this announcement but on Twitter, the platform that he co-founded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The CEO of the popular social network confirming in a letter to staff that he would be stepping down from his role as chief executive and leaving the company after nearly 16 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Dorsey is to be replaced by Twitter's current chief technical officer Parag Agrawal, but he is going to remain on the board until the end of his term next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Dorsey said it was a tough decision, but he also says that he doesn't believe companies should be led by their founders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: He has certainly been essential to Twitter since the very start.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: He was their CEO until 2008 before being ousted from the role, but then being reappointed as Chief Executive in 2015.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Since then however, Dorsey has come under criticism, people saying that he is not letting go of the reins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In addition to Twitter, Jack Dorsey is also the executive of Square, a financial payments company that he has also founded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And some senior investors have questioned how effective he can be as the leader of both Twitter and Square.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But he has now confirmed that he will be resigning with immediate effect as CEO of Twitter, telling employees in that letter that he believes they have the ability to change the course of the company for the better, but also repeating that he believes it's critical that companies aren't led by their founders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: it's critical that companies aren't led by their founders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: With Christmas approaching, fears grow that the global supply chain issues will prevent shoppers from buying their favorite gifts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Here at the Port of Antwerp, docks are working at full capacity to shorten the waiting time for transport and retail companies that struggle with higher consumer demand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: What we see here in Antwerp is a delay of one to two days for ships and 20 to 30% of the ships are coming in on time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But if you put it into perspective and compare it to other ports, we have heard about, for example, the ports in the west coast of the United States and there we see a delay of eight to nine days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The port of Antwerp is Europe's second largest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: 64,000 people work here to handle some 12 million containers a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: With only 15% of them coming from Asia, this harbor has been less vulnerable to the logistics bottlenecks that arose after the post-lockdown manufacturing rebound.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Port authorities say other factors have also eased the burden on Antwerp.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We handle a broad area of goods. This makes us less vulnerable in these situations. Something that we also have to take into consideration here in Europe is that there are multiple ports nearby.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So if shipping lines notice the busyness in Rotterdam or here in Antwerp, they can easily transfer to other ports. But according to retail representatives, this won't be enough to prevent a shortage of specific goods imported from outside Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The areas where there have been some major disruptions for our sector have been in three main areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That's clothing, electronics, and toys.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And that's really related to the production of those products in the Far East.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Then the whole problem of a shortage of sea freight capacity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: These items are not only popular under the Christmas tree, but they could also weigh on the EU's economic forecast for 2022 if they remain in short supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Brian Carter for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: New York's Empire State Building is lit up in the colors of the french flag in honor of josephine baker as she becomes the first black woman to be reinterred at the pantheon monument in paris the american-born singer and dancer became a mega star in the 1930s especially in france where she moved in 1925 as she was seeking to flee racism and segregation in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But it's for her work as part of the French resistance during World War II that she's regarded as a hero in France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Amid other missions, she collected information from German officials she met at parties and carried messages hidden in her underwear to England and other countries using her star status to justify her travels. She became a French citizen after her marriage to industrialist Jean Lion in 1937 and after her death in 1975 she was buried in Monaco. Now on the insistence of French President Emmanuel Macron she's to become the fifth woman and the first entertainer honored with a Pantheon burial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Her mother was an unmarried African-American housemaid. As a child she stole to help feed her family, But the entertainer Josephine Baker became a huge international star in the 1930s after moving to Paris and performing at the Folies Bergères and today, 46 years after her death, she joins the ranks of France's greatest men and women when she's inducted into the Pontéon just behind me. This houses the tombs or memorials of the country's national heroes, and the tents you can see behind me and the music you may be able to hear in the background are part of preparations for the ceremony in her honour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Josephine Baker was a French resistance agent during the Second World War, and she fought against racism in the US with Martin Luther King.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Now, she's the first American, the first entertainer, and the first black woman to be honoured with a memorial in the Panthéon. President Macron will speak at its unveiling, which will be covered live on French TV.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Panthéon is the resting place of 75 great French men, including the writers Victor Hugo, Voltaire and Alexandre Dumas. But Josephine Baker is only the sixth woman to be commemorated here, alongside the scientist Marie Curie and the Holocaust survivor and politician Simone Veil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Argentina's Lionel Messi has won the Ballon d'Or award for the best player in the world, again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: It's the seventh time he has received football's most prestigious individual trophy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Paris Saint-Germain and Argentina forward helped his country win the Copa America, his first international honour, and has scored 40 goals in 2021. The truth is that I never thought about the seventh nor do I think about the eighth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So I'm looking forward to this new stage of my life at my new club, Paris, where I'm totally happy, adapted and eager to achieve a new goal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Bayern Munich and Poland striker Robert Lewandowski came second, and Chelsea and Italy midfielder Giorgino was third.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Taking the Women's Award for Best Female Player in 2021 was Barcelona captain Alexia Pataez.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: She helped Barca secure their first Champions League crown, beating Chelsea 4-0.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Sports journalist Michael Curran told Euronews that despite tough competition in the male category, the Argentinian maestro was a fitting winner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: For Messi, some people may look at this award and go, well, actually, yes, it's incredible for Messi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: You know, he's won it for the seventh time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But what about Lewandowski?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Because he's had a great season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Has Messi's season been as good?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Well, let's not forget, he scored 41 goals, 17 assists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Messi also won the Copa del Rey and also, of course, the Copa America, finally winning that major trophy with Argentina. So yes, you do feel for Robert Lewandowski. Should he have won it last year? Should he have won it this year? But he did pick up the Striker of the Year award. So he's not gone home empty-handed. And Messi, of course, winning that seventh Ballon d'Or. Cristiano Ronaldo, of course, wanting to win loads of Ballon d'Ors as well of course for him. He finished sixth which is the first time outside the top five since 2010.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's it from me and the entire team here. Do stay with us as we bring you all the latest from across Europe and don't forget you can stay up to date with the latest stories on euronews.com.
